rationale: before auto-takeoff mode, the sensor selection output shall with probability > 0.99 eventually satisfy detection of correct runway entry
fulltext: before auto_takeoff_mode SensorSelection shall with probability >0.99 eventually satisfy detect_correct_entry

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval (if defined) from the start of the execution to (and exclusive of) the first point where auto_takeoff_mode holds. In the interval defined by the entire execution, if auto_takeoff_mode never holds. If auto_takeoff_mode holds initially, the requirement is vacuously satisfied. TRIGGER: first point in the interval. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale: Upon LECDiSAGREE, sensor selection component output shall with probability > 0.9 at next time point (or within 10 milliseconds) satisfy ACCURATE
fulltext: upon LEC_disagree SensorSelection shall with probability > 0.9 at the next timepoint satisfy q_hat =q

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: first point in the interval if (LEC_disagree) is true and any point in the interval where (LEC_disagree) becomes true (from false). REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at the next time step.

rationale: Upon LECDiSAGREE, sensor selection component output shall with probability > 0.9 at next time point (or within 10 milliseconds) satisfy ACCURATE
fulltext: upon LEC_disagree SensorSelection shall with probability > 0.9 within 10 milliseconds satisfy q_hat =q

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: first point in the interval if (LEC_disagree) is true and any point in the interval where (LEC_disagree) becomes true (from false). REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some point with distance <= 10 from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+10). If the interval ends sooner than trigger+10, then RES need not hold.

rationale: Upon out-of-distribution_event OODDetector shall with probability ≥ 0.9 after 5 time units satisfy InputDataIsOOD ( no need to specify a mode) fK output of the OOD Detection
fulltext: upon ood_event OODDetector shall with probability >= 0.99 after 5 ticks satisfy f_k

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: first point in the interval if (ood_event) is true and any point in the interval where (ood_event) becomes true (from false). REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=5 from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+5). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance 5+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+5+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

rationale: sensor_selection component shall always satisfy ACCURATE (IN IDEAL CONDITIONS, perfect weather, perfect lighting, on the ground, perfectly marked airport, stationary)
fulltext: whenever idealConditions SensorSelection shall immediately satisfy  q_hat = q

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (idealConditions) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale: Whenever a runway incursion, RunwayIntrusionDetector, with probability greater than (99.99%), detects an incursion before 10 time units.
fulltext: whenever q_k RunwayIntrusionDetector shall with probability > 0.9999 within 10  ticks satisfy incursionDetected

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (q_k) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some point with distance <= 10 from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+10). If the interval ends sooner than trigger+10, then RES need not hold.

rationale: When inaccurate, the Runway Detector with probability greater than 99% become accurate within 100 time units.
fulltext: whenever inaccurate RunwayDetector shall with probability >0.99 within 100 ticks satisfy q_hat=q

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (inaccurate) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some point with distance <= 100 from the trigger (i.e., at trigger, trigger+1, ..., or trigger+100). rationale: Whenever one or more LECs are inaccurate, sensor selection output shall with probability  >0.98 at the next timepoint satisfy accurate
